data.title: Love This Place
data.text: I have been dining here for years and Never had a bad experience.  Breakfast or lunch you get Great food for great prices!

data.title: Typical Diner
data.text:
My parents swear by this place.  They go pretty much every day.  And there is something to be said for the service to inspire that kind of loyalty.  Most of the staff are quite friendly, and there's obviously a large group of regulars that will make you feel at home.  As long as you don't take their spot.

I, my wife, and my kids go with them only once a week, and that's because there are better breakfasts in the area.  The food is typical diner food.  There's nothing particularly exceptional about it, but there's nothing really bad to say about it, either.  Everything I've ever had there has tasted more or less the same.  Not good, not bad, just there.  For what you get, the prices are also a little on the high side.

If you're hungry, in a hurry, and not too picky, you'll be satisfied with your visit to the Tower.

data.title: An old time favorite
data.text: Went for a birthday breakfast. The food was plentiful. The staff was friendly. Brings back memories of an old fashioned diner. Worth the time. Close to Rt. 8. Would definately go back.

data.title: Very Good Diner Food; Fast, Delicious; Highly Recommend
data.text: My friend has been here over the years and brought me here today. This was my first time at the Tower Grill. For lunch I had the Junction Surprise sandwich -- turkey breast, roasted red peppers, grilled onions, swiss cheese and russian dressing on grilled rye bread ($7.95). It was tasty and delicious, and included french fries (I substituted home fries), cole slaw and pickle slices. My friend had a club sandwich that he enjoyed. The service was quick and friendly. The place was clean - I even saw the server washing the window sills. I would return here. Highly recommend.

data.title: Old School Diner
data.text: Located off Freight street in a gritty part of town, the Tower Grill remains a throwback diner with basic good food done well.   One of the few places I've found that does a good biscuits and gravy.   Best for breakfast in my opinion as I've only eaten breakfast there.  Small and you may have a wait on the weekends but it's worth it.  Food comes out pretty quick.  Very near Rt. 8, easy to get too.

data.title: Waterbury's best!
data.text: Hasn't changed  much since  i  was  a  kid.  Good  food  ,  great  service  a+ quick on and  off of  route 8 .  plenty of  parking.  Maybe enough  along  the  side  for  a  bus  of  trailer.

data.title: Great breakfast!!
data.text: Tower grill is an icon in the city of waterbury.. it's a typical diner.. breakfast is fantastic I highly suggest you get the rye bread toast D Lish

data.title: Breakfast favorite!
data.text: Classic old style diner, been around for decades - neat & clean and never empty. A local favorite for typical diner food - we love their breakfast options. Cash only - free standing ATM on site. Been going there for years, same friendly staff who serve you well.

data.title: Some 5 star food, some 2 star food, decent service
data.text:
This was our first trip to Tower Grill. This is a spacious diner with plenty of seating. Very clean with lots of natural light. We were taken care of by a very attentive and friendly waitress.  

I already knew I wanted the biscuits with sausage and gravy, which I ordered with eggs over hard. Delicious! Gravy had a nice peppery kick that hit the back of the palate. Biscuits were perfectly cooked. Had a glass of cranberry juice with it. All in all, a fantastic breakfast for me. 

Husband was not so pleased. He decided on pancakes and sausage. He prefers patties but they had links and they came out overcooked and a bit tasteless. His pancakes were dry with absolutely no flavor. He did love his coffee, though. When the waitress came to see how things were, I mentioned the problem with the pancakes. She should have just taken his plate and brought him new ones, but instead, she said something about next time we come in, she'll make sure he gets fresh ones. What does that mean exactly? That there are old ones back there? 

So, I have to score Tower Grill as average. I'm dying to go back because I had great food. Given my husband's experience, I'm sure I'll have to plead my case to get him to go back.

data.title: Classic Diner
data.text: The Tower Grill is your old-fashioned diner--good food at reasonable prices.  I usually go for the breakfast, which has an early bird special.  The atmosphere is friendly.  Good, down home feeling to the place.

data.title: Years and years of Service
data.text: The Tower Grill has been around forever it seems. I enjoy their breakfast and lunch and the wait staff hardly ever changes so you get to know everyone. I truly enjoy going there.
